page.title: 12 FARMING
page.content: In seven out of our twelve squares of the national grid, we discovered that arable farming predominated. Crops were in abundance, main crops being wheat, barley, potatoes and cabbage. Much of the land is grassland both gazed and ungrazed land and some of the grassland is cut for hay ready for winter feeding for the animals. With regards to animal farming we found that sheep and cows were of the greatest importance with most farms having chickens for eggs and for meat. The main breeds of cattle are Fresians at Merrishaw farm and Upper Springs , for example and Charolais at Broomcroft. On the whole the farms had large flocks of sheep and these were grazed on three squares of our grid at Kenley, Stone House and Harley.
